Plot a Heatmap of Identified Marker Features

markerHeatmap.Rd

This function will plot a heatmap of the results from markerFeatures

This function will plot a heatmap of the results from markerFeatures

markerHeatmap(seMarker, cutOff = "FDR <= 0.001 & Log2FC >= 0.1",
  log2Norm = TRUE, scaleTo = 10^4, scaleRows = TRUE, limits = c(-2,
  2), grepExclude = NULL, pal = NULL, binaryClusterRows = TRUE,
  labelMarkers = NULL, labelTop = NULL, labelRows = FALSE,
  returnMat = FALSE, ...)

markerHeatmap(seMarker, cutOff = "FDR <= 0.001 & Log2FC >= 0.1",
  log2Norm = TRUE, scaleTo = 10^4, scaleRows = TRUE, limits = c(-2,
  2), grepExclude = NULL, pal = NULL, binaryClusterRows = TRUE,
  labelMarkers = NULL, labelTop = NULL, labelRows = FALSE,
  returnMat = FALSE, ...)

Arguments

seMarker

Summarized Experiment result from markerFeatures
log2Norm

log2 Normalization prior to plotting set true for counting assays (not DeviationsMatrix!)
scaleTo

scale to prior to log2 Normalization, if log2Norm is FALSE this does nothing
scaleRows

compute row z-scores on matrix
limits

heatmap color limits
grepExclude

remove features by grep
pal

palette for heatmap, default will use solar_extra
binaryClusterRows

fast clustering implementation for row clustering by binary sorting
labelMarkers

label specific markers by name on heatmap (matches rownames of seMarker)
labelTop

label the top features for each column in seMarker
labelRows

label all rows
returnMat

return final matrix that is used for plotting heatmap
...

additional args
cutoff

Logical Statement for Cutoff to Be called a Marker a statement containing assayNames from seMarker
seMarker

Summarized Experiment result from markerFeatures
cutoff

Logical Statement for Cutoff to Be called a Marker a statement containing assayNames from seMarker
log2Norm

log2 Normalization prior to plotting set true for counting assays (not DeviationsMatrix!)
scaleTo

scale to prior to log2 Normalization, if log2Norm is FALSE this does nothing
scaleRows

compute row z-scores on matrix
limits

heatmap color limits
grepExclude

remove features by grep
pal

palette for heatmap, default will use solar_extra
binaryClusterRows

fast clustering implementation for row clustering by binary sorting
labelMarkers

label specific markers by name on heatmap (matches rownames of seMarker)
labelTop

label the top features for each column in seMarker
labelRows

label all rows
returnMat

return final matrix that is used for plotting heatmap
...

additional args
